Key Arguments: The legislation could throttle free speech and discussion.
Past efforts to control misinformation, such as during Covid, failed and promoted only one viewpoint.
Determining what constitutes misinformation or disinformation is subjective and historically has been proven wrong.
Free and open discussions should be encouraged in a democratic society.
Notable Quotes: We all saw how the Covid misinformation/disinformation lockdown failed so dismally, promoting only one viewpoint, which turned out to be the voice of money and power, not the voice of health and reason.

Once upon the earth was flat. Once upon a time the sun revolved around the earth. Both points that were ferociously upheld and fought for - killed for! - by the leaders of their times, and both proved to be very wrong.
We really don't need a watchdog telling us what to think.
